segments.text: I see a woman standing by the sink, completely absorbed in drying a plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She hasn’t even noticed the water overflowing onto the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is already in the puddle, but she doesn’t seem to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder how long the sink has been overflowing like this.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are up to something behind her, but she’s oblivious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe she hasn’t heard the water spilling everywhere.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kitchen is going to be a mess if this keeps up.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I should probably say something before it gets worse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But what if she doesn’t even notice me?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This is ridiculous—how can someone be this unaware?
segments.speaker: PAR
